title: Why Lord Krishna Accepts the Smallest Offering? | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The speaker explains that Saligram Shila is a self-manifest form of Krishna that doesn't require installation and is directly worshipable.

segments.key_quote: Of all the Deities that you can worship, all types of Deity worship you can do, the easiest is to worship the Saligram Shila.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the ease of worshipping Saligram Shila with devotion, emphasizing the importance of offering even simple items like a Tulasi leaf and water with love.

segments.key_quote: He sells Himself completely to His devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna values devotion so much that He considers Himself sold to a devotee who offers even a simple Tulasi leaf and water with love.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the property of His pure devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates how Advaita Acharya worshipped Saligram Shila with devotion, leading to the appearance of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, and emphasizes that Krishna is the property of His pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: Only Prabhupada can give us Krishna nobody else can give us Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker states that only Prabhupada can give us Krishna, emphasizing the importance of the Vaishnava Acharyas.

segments.key_quote: Desiring to understand the glory of Radharani's love.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to explain the three internal reasons for Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's appearance, starting with Krishna's desire to understand the glory of Radharani's love.

segments.key_quote: The wonderful qualities in him that she alone relishes through her love.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the second internal reason: Krishna wants to understand the special qualities of Radharani that allow her to relish His wonderful qualities in a unique way.

segments.key_quote: The happiness she feels when she realizes the sweetness of his love that is the third reason.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the explanation of the three internal reasons, focusing on Krishna's desire to experience the happiness Radharani feels when she realizes the sweetness of His love.
